result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Martin, April A

records.addlTxt:
9:28 AM Defendant April A Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for April A Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed. 
Defendant to be returned to the Manitowoc County Jail forthwith.
Attorney Kershek requests a date further out as the defendant is currently pending on other matters and they would like time to see if those cases are resolved.  
Clerk's office to set up video appearance from Manitowoc County Jail for the next date.
Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Request for adjournment filed by DA**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 9/26 "Matter may not be adjourned off the record as Marsy's Law protections may exist for any potential victims. The existing date, however, will be amended to a preliminary hearing status date. Any other witnesses scheduled to appear may be called off."
AMENDED Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
TTY from Manitowoc PD re: detainer
Detainer placed at: Manitowoc Co Jail
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Manitowoc County Jail

Defendant to have no contact with codefendant/individual/victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

2:02 PM Defendant April A Martin appeared by video from Manitowoc County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for April A Martin. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Nikki Kane.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.  Office to prepare Order to Produce from Manitowoc County Jail by 10/13/2022.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for April A Martin
Current: C/O Manitowoc County Jail, 1025 S 9th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 08-18-2022)
Prior: 1025 S 9th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220

8:39 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant April A Martin not in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for April A Martin. 

Attorney Kershek states that the Defendant is currently incarcerated in the Manitowoc County Jail. 
The Court verifies that the Defendant is indeed in custody.
The Court will adjourn the initial appearance.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR VIA ZOOM FROM THE MANITOWOC COUNTY JAIL FOR THE NEXT APPEARANCE.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
